Package com.sanyavertolet.interview.math.expressions

Class BinaryExpression

java.lang.Object
com.sanyavertolet.interview.math.expressions.Expression
com.sanyavertolet.interview.math.expressions.BinaryExpression
public class BinaryExpression extends Expression
Represents a binary expression in a formula or computation. A BinaryExpression consists of two sub-expressions (left and right) and an operator that defines the operation to be performed between them.

    • BinaryExpression

      public BinaryExpression(Expression left, Expression right, NonFunctionOperator operator)
      Constructs a BinaryExpression with the specified left and right expressions and an operator.
      Parameters:
      left - the left-hand side expression.
      right - the right-hand side expression.
      operator - the operator used in the binary expression.

  • Method Details

    • prettyPrint

      public String prettyPrint(int shift)
      Returns a pretty-printed string representation of the binary expression. The output is indented according to the specified shift value. The operator appears at the current level, with left and right operands indented further.
      Specified by:
      prettyPrint in class Expression
      Parameters:
      shift - the number of dots to prepend for indentation.
      Returns:
      a formatted string representing the binary expression.

    • getCellReferences

      public List<CellReference> getCellReferences()
      Returns a list of cell references that are found within the left and right sub-expressions. This method aggregates cell references from both operands.
      Specified by:
      getCellReferences in class Expression
      Returns:
      a list containing all cell references from the left and right expressions.

    • getLeft

      public Expression getLeft()
      Returns the left-hand side expression of this binary expression.
      Returns:
      the left expression.

    • getRight

      public Expression getRight()
      Returns the right-hand side expression of this binary expression.
      Returns:
      the right expression.

    • getOperator

      public NonFunctionOperator getOperator()
      Returns the operator used in this binary expression.
      Returns:
      the operator.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the binary expression. The format is: "leftExpression operator rightExpression".
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      the string representation of the binary expression.
